Review
This stylish prohibition-era inspired loft is more than your typical Air B&B experience. This location provides modern amenities and comforts with an added bit of interest and fun. Everything we needed for our stay was provided, the beds were comfortable and the TV was pre loaded with Netflix to keep our little ones entertained while we got situated. The place was clean, organized and easy to quickly settle into. Megan was very responsive and clear with instructions so there were no lingering questions or concerns as everything was provided up front.
We had 3 adults and three kids (7, 5 and 2), all slept comfortably. We did notice the baby gate below the stairs which was a nice consideration. The upstairs area slept my 5 and 7 year old with no problem. I am 6â€™1â€ and had to duck my head about an inch to walk around but watching a movie or playing poker at the table, you wouldnâ€™t have to worry about that. The remainder of the space was open and very comfortable.
The loft is conveniently located within walking distance of a several food and drink options and a park/playground. Overnight parking is not allowed at curbside but there is a public lot around the corner. I was a little nervous about it at first but I awoke in the morning to find my van plus a handful of other cars there, all untouched. Overall, I felt the area was safe despite some of the surrounding buildings and homes being in disrepair. That said, there are several places like Lincolnâ€™s Loft as well as Mamaâ€™s Arcade Cafe and The Guest House Coffee Shop which lead me to believe Lincoln may be on the cusp of re-emerging as a community deeply rooted in its own history while altogether writing a vibrant new chapter. I highly recommend.
